abstract: The gap between extreme users and the rest of the population is widening, according to Arieso, a company that advises mobile operators.
lead_paragraph: The world's congested mobile airwaves are being divided in a lopsided manner, with 1 percent of consumers generating half of all traffic. The top 10 percent of users, meanwhile, are consuming 90 percent of wireless bandwidth, reports Kevin J. O'Brien in The New York Times. Read more »

headline.main: Top 1% of Mobile Users Consume Half of World's Bandwidth, and Gap Is Growing
